}}
â
Mexican Americans account for more than 53% of the United States' population: over 30,000,000 Americans listed their ancestry as Mexican as of 2010, forming about 64% of all [[Hispanic and Latino Americans|Hispanics and Latinos]] in the United States.<ref name=Tafoya>{{cite web |url=http://pewhispanic.org/files/reports/35.pdf |title=Shades of Belonging |last=Tafoya |first=Sonya |accessdate=2008-06-03 |publisher=[[Pew Research Center|Pew Hispanic Center]] |date=2004-12-06 |format=PDF}}</ref> The United States is home to the second largest Mexican community in the world, second only to [[Mexico]] itself.<ref>[http://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/DTTable?_bm=y&-geo_id=01000US&-ds_name=ACS_2009_1YR_G00_&-_lang=en&-redoLog=true&-mt_name=ACS_2009_1YR_G2000_B03001&-format=&-CONTEXT=dt B03001. HISPANIC OR LATINO ORIGIN BY SPECIFIC ORIGIN]</ref>
+
Mexican Americans account for more than 16% of the United States' population: over 30,000,000 Americans listed their ancestry as Mexican as of 2010, forming about 64% of all [[Hispanic and Latino Americans|Hispanics and Latinos]] in the United States.<ref name=Tafoya>{{cite web |url=http://pewhispanic.org/files/reports/35.pdf |title=Shades of Belonging |last=Tafoya |first=Sonya |accessdate=2008-06-03 |publisher=[[Pew Research Center|Pew Hispanic Center]] |date=2004-12-06 |format=PDF}}</ref> The United States is home to the second largest Mexican community in the world, second only to [[Mexico]] itself.<ref>[http://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/DTTable?_bm=y&-geo_id=01000US&-ds_name=ACS_2009_1YR_G00_&-_lang=en&-redoLog=true&-mt_name=ACS_2009_1YR_G2000_B03001&-format=&-CONTEXT=dt B03001. HISPANIC OR LATINO ORIGIN BY SPECIFIC ORIGIN]</ref>
Most Mexican Americans are the descendants of the [[Indigenous peoples of Mexico]] and/or [[European ethnic groups|Europeans]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/379167/Mexico#tab=active~checked%2Citems~checked&title=Mexico%20--%20Britannica%20Online20Encyclopedia |title=Mexico - Britannica Online Encyclopedia}}</ref><ref>http://historiamexicana.colmex.mx/pdf/13/art_13_1938_16335.pdf</ref> especially [[Spanish people|Spaniards]]. Mexican American settlement concentrations are in metropolitan and rural areas across the United States.
Most Mexican Americans are the descendants of the [[Indigenous peoples of Mexico]] and/or [[European ethnic groups|Europeans]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/379167/Mexico#tab=active~checked%2Citems~checked&title=Mexico%20--%20Britannica%20Online20Encyclopedia |title=Mexico - Britannica Online Encyclopedia}}</ref><ref>http://historiamexicana.colmex.mx/pdf/13/art_13_1938_16335.pdf</ref> especially [[Spanish people|Spaniards]]. Mexican American settlement concentrations are in metropolitan and rural areas across the United States.
